plausible_answers.text: a number of field, laboratory, and numerical modeling methods

qas.question: What do scientists use to determine the process of river movement?
What is another word for the study of past and current life?
What method studies the positions of glaciers and their subsurface?
What are sedimentary layers used to investigate?

plausible_answers.text: field, laboratory, and numerical modeling methods

qas.question: What do Geologists use to study processes outside of the earth?

plausible_answers.text: modern soils, rivers, landscapes, and glaciers

qas.question: What are used in non-typical investigations?
What do geologists use to investigate the surface?
What ancient property do geologists study?

context: Geologists use a number of field, laboratory, and numerical modeling methods to decipher Earth history and understand the processes that occur on and inside the Earth. In typical geological investigations, geologists use primary information related to petrology (the study of rocks), stratigraphy (the study of sedimentary layers), and structural geology (the study of positions of rock units and their deformation). In many cases, geologists also study modern soils, rivers, landscapes, and glaciers; investigate past and current life and biogeochemical pathways, and use geophysical methods to investigate the subsurface.
